title: Album Page, "Elevation and Plan of Second Window, Possibly at Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, top of sheet: 2nd window; below drawing of window: elevation; to right of sketch of window: section.  Numerous inscriptions about the dimensions of the window are written below.  Verso, in graphite: section dome should be almost 11 metres above sill of / front window, cornice of dome ie, where dome. . . / should be between 360 and 390 / height of spire to top of bell = 12.25 / storm coping = 1.60 / Chiavelle [Chiaravelle]; at right corner of sheet: 99.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.6 x 19.4 cm (12 1/16 x 7 5/8 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet tipped into binding depicting an elevation of a window inset with an arcade supported by three slender columns.  Below this is a section through the window sketched above.  A further detailed section of the columnar supports has been sketched below this and included dimensions and measurements.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Elevation and Plan of Second Window, Possibly at Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-261.
